Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.5192. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0288 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. 7. Set the sketch scale to 0.5192. The first part of the CAD model is complete, and it serves as the base for the subsequent parts. **Part 2: Cylindrical Hole** We will now create a cylindrical hole in one of the faces of the rectangular prism. Finally, after creating the cylindrical hole, you will have the complete CAD model. Ensure the order of operations is correct when combining the base prism and cylindrical hole, such that the hole is properly cut into the prism. Remember to use the provided CAD Assembly JSON while following these instructions to ensure all values and coordinates are accurate.</description>
